summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons incident report detailing an apparent suicide attempt by inmate Jeffery Epstein in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York on July 23, 2019. The report states Epstein was found with an orange homemade rope around his neck, unresponsive but breathing, and was removed from the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

persons.name: Jeffery Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found in his cell with an orange homemade rope around his neck, unresponsive but breathing, in an apparent suicide attempt.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate who alerted staff to the incident, stating Epstein had attempted to hang himself.

connections.description: Were housed together in cell 124 in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: Jeffery Epstein was found in his cell with an orange homemade rope around his neck after an apparent suicide attempt. He was unresponsive but breathing and was removed from the Special Housing Unit.

keyFacts: Jeffery Epstein was involved in an incident of 'self-mutilation' (Prohibited Act Code 228) on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM.
Epstein was found with an orange homemade rope around his neck in his cell (124) in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
Epstein's cellmate, Tartaglione, alerted staff to the incident, stating Epstein had attempted to hang himself.
Epstein was breathing but unresponsive when found; staff removed the rope and he was taken out of the SHU.
The incident was documented on a Federal Bureau of Prisons form (BP-A0288) and referred to a Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO).
